p.rend: This file may be used to illustrate the use of items and components for the description of sources. For instance, note the description of specific copies of a print separate from the general description of the print run (sourcesA,Detc.), and the description of sets of parts (HandJ), giving a general description of the set as well as descriptions of the individual parts. SourceJcombines these two options to describe a printed set of parts and a specific copy of it.
SourcesJandNalso have reprint editions defined by means of relations between the sources.
Please note: The content of this file has been modified for demonstration purposes and does not represent accurate real-world data.

termList.term: Music for choir, vocal soloists and instruments

expression.title: No. 1. Chor der Krieger und Barden
No. 1. Fingals Krigere

incipText.p: Auf, auf, auf, laut schallt das Horn
Frem, frem, frem, fremad til Kamp

expression.title: No. 2
No. 2

incipText.p: Heute noch brech' ich des stolzen Königs Macht
Alt i Kvæld slaar jeg den stolte Konges Hær

expression.tempo: Andante – Più lento – Andante con moto

incipText.p: Auf, auf in die Schlacht, Fingal führt uns zum Sieg!
Frem, fremad til Kamp, fremad til Kamp. Fingal fører til Seir.
O grauenvolle Stille! Dahin, dahin sind die lieblichen Träume
Hvor alt er tyst og stille. De svandt, de svandt de livsalige Drømme!
Vom Lochlin kam gezogen Suaran, der stolze Held
Suaran, den Lochlins Konge, drog over Bølgen blaa

expression.title: No. 6
No. 6

incipText.p: Still, still ist die Jagd, kein Laut ertönt, als das Brausen des Stroms
Ak! Snart er det Nat, alt Vinden suser i Granernes Top.

expression.tempo: Moderato – Allegro non troppo – Più allegro

incipText.p: Wir wandeln auf dem Sturm
Vi drage som Storm over Hede
O, o, dass ich nicht sitze an Caruns Wellen
O! o! sad jeg dog hist ved Caruns Vover!
Entfloh'n ist der Feind' Getöse, nicht sieht man sein Ross auf den Höhen
Nu flygter den stolte Caracul, hans Ganger foer bort over Heden

expression.title: No. 10
No. 10

incipText.p: Lasst ab vom lauten Siegsgesang, ihr Krieger Fingals, schweigt, o schweigt!
O stands den glade Seierssang, du Fingals Kriger ti, o ti!

expression.tempo: Andante con moto – Più vivace – Tempo I

incipText.p: Lasst mich schauen die Geliebte, zeiget, wo die Holde schläft
Sorgens Taarer stille svæve om min Elsktes Hvilested.

expression.title: No. 12. Chor der Barden und Jungfrauen
No. 12

incipText.p: Aus den Wolken herab schauen die Geister der Ahnen
Høit fra Skyernes Krands skue de Henfarnes Aander

p.rend: COMALA. Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / für Solo, Chor und Orchester / in Musik gesetzt / von / Niels. W. Gade. / Op. 12. / [...] / Eigenthum der Verleger. / LEIPZIG UND BRÜSSEL, BREITKOPF & HÄRTEL. / Eingetragen in das Vereinsarchiv. / 7543. 10863 16300. Ch.B.59. V.A.429.

annot.p: Paperback, sewn, in grey cover. On the front cover is printed a list of Gade’s"Grössere Gesangwerke mit Orchesterbegleitung"published by Breitkopf & Härtel. The leaf following the title page contains the argument and the text (in German) with reference to page numbers. An unchanged lithographic reproduction of this first edition was published around 1893 with the plate number Part. B. 706.

item.label: Ag: Printed score, Gade’s personal copy

annot.p: The dating1887is added in blue crayon on front cover, in Gade’s hand. The copy does not contain any annotations or additions except for a correction in pencil to the tenor parts in No.1, bar 87. Otherwise asA.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Comala / dramatisches Gedicht / nach Ossian / componirt / von / Niels W: Gade. / Op. 12. / Leipzig/ bey / Breitkopf u. Härtel. Added in pencil, in Gade’s hand:(1845-46.)

annot.p: In full cloth binding stampedCOMALA.in gold on front cover. Hand-written label pasted on front cover inscribedOp. 12. / Comala / Partitur.Pagination is sporadic, pages 107-162 incorrectly paginated 106-161. At the end of the music on p. 161 [recte 162] is the datingLeipzig den 11 Märtz 1846 / Königstr: No16.At top of page 3 inscribed in runes ᚵᚢᚦ: ᚵᛁᚢᛅ: ᛚᚤᚴᚴᛅ: (GUD GIVE LYKKE).

titleStmt.title: Score, manuscript copy from Breitkopf & Härtel

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Ornamental frame andBREITKOPF & HÄRTEL IN LEIPZIG.printed on front cover. Title added in ink:Comala / von / N. W. Gade. / Partitur

physDesc.physMedium: Written on light blue paper. Hand-ruled (22 staves).

annot.p: In half binding; brown cardboard cover with green cloth on spine and corners. Label pasted on front cover stampedMus-n / 1493. Stamped below the label:Fürstl. Bestand. Pp. 2-228 paginated in pencil. Both layers of additions are in the same hand, the ones in pencil apparently added first. Additions are mainly completions of dynamic indications, but also some exclusively performance-related. The first cut in No. 9 found inAandBwas also applied inCas is apparent from pencil crosses on pp. 162 and 171 and from the bended corners of the pages in between. Condition: very good, few traces of use.Manuscript copy as sold by Breitkopf & Härtel between 1846 and 1889. Several other such publisher-made copies are known, though copied by different hands (D-Sl HB XVII 177; D-LEm PM 5044; I-OS Mss.Mus.A 8). Together with the score is an incomplete set of parts (14 manuscript parts: S.1 (2), S.2 (3), A.1 (2), A.2, T.1, B.1 (3), B.2 and cb., probably written by a local scribe, and 1 printed part: Dersagrena).

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: COMALA / Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / für Solo, Chor und Orchester / in Musik gesetzt / von / Niels W. Gade. / Op. 12. / Clavierauszug. / Eigenthum der Verleger. / Leipzig, bei Breitkopf & Härtel. / 7540. / Eingetragen in das Vereinsarchiv.. A reprint of the vocal score has the pricePr. 3 Thlr. 10 Ngr. = Mk.10._added below the publisher's name. The reprint omits the dedication and has the initial argument and libretto re-set.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: On the second leaf:SEINER MAJESTÄT / dem Könige von Dänemark / CHRISTIAN VIII. / ehrfurchtsvoll gewidmet.

annot.p: Pages 1-2 unpaginated, containing the argument and text (in German). Page 74 blank. The copies studied are in binding not retaining the original cover. The vocal score was announced as a novelty of "last week" inSignale für die musikalische Welt4 (November 1846), p. 358, and in Hofmeister'sMusikalisch-literarischer Monatsberichtin January 1847.

item.label: Dmf1: Vocal score, first edition, The Music Society's copy

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Title on front cover (cut-out from original cover):Comala / von / GADE. / Op. 12. / Clavierauszug. / Leipzig, bei Breitkopf & Härtel. / Pr. 3 Thlr. 10 Ngr.

annot.p: In leather half-binding with marbled sides. Oval cut-out from the original cover pasted on front cover. Printed label pasted on front cover in lower left corner:Musikforeningens Archiv. / Claveer-Udtog., stamped127and with the title added in ink:Gade, N. W / Comala / (med underlagtdanskText). Danish text added in ink throughout (probably in 1871). A few changes are added in pencil, in Gades hand. Numerous notes on the instrumentation added in pencil in an unknown hand. Very worn copy; lower corners missing from many pages. Otherwise asD.

item.label: Dmf2: Vocal score, first edition, The Music Society's copy

annot.p: In cloth quarter binding with marbled sides. Printed label pasted on front cover in lower left corner:Musikforeningens Archiv. / Claveer-Udtog. / B. No.[added in ink:]127; title added in ink:Gade / Comala. Danish Text added in pencil in at least three different hands and partly also in blue crayon. Otherwise asD.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Comala's part:COMALA / Dramatisches Gedicht nach Ossian / in Musik gesetzt von / NIELS W. GADE. / Op. 12. / SINGSTIMMEN. / Eigenthum der Verleger. / Leipzig, bei Breitkopf & Härtel. / Comala.

annot.p: Text in German.13 parts: Comala, Dersagrena, Melicoma, Fingal, Soprano I, Sopran II Solo, Sopran II, Alt I, Alt II, Tenor I, Tenor II, Bass I, Bass II. The parts were announced as a novelty of "last week" inSignale für die musikalische Welt4 (November 1846), p. 358, and in Hofmeister'sMusikalisch-literarischer Monatsberichtin January 1847.

item.label: Fg1: Printed vocal parts, Gade’s personal copy

annot.p: Includes the choral parts only. Otherwise asFI.

item.label: Fmf1: Printed vocal parts, The Music Society's copy

annot.p: 98 parts: Comala (2), Melicoma (2), Fingal (2), Soprano I (12), Sopran II Solo, Sopran II (12), Alt I (11), Alt II (11), Tenor I (10), Tenor II (12), Bass I (12), Bass II (11). Incomplete; Dersagrena missing.Each part glued in a blue paper cover with the part's name and the number 127 orN. W. Gade / Comalaadded in ink. Danish text added in pencil, ink, or red ball pen to some of the solo parts: Comala (1), Melicoma (2), Fingal (2). In Fingal's parts, changes to a higher pitch in No. 2 (as inB) are added in pencil. One copy of Fingal's part has the Danish text added in ink, with numerous changes added in pencil (19th century?). The other copy has the Danish text added in red ball pen (20th century), retaining the changes made in pencil in the first copy.Otherwise asFI.

5 parts: Comala, Dersagrena (2), Melicoma (2). Incomplete; Fingal missing. Dersagrena [1] and Melicoma [1] copied by the same scribe, presumably for the 1856 performance in Copenhagen. Dersagrena [2] apparently copied by the same scribe as Dersagrena [1] and Melicoma [1] for the first performance in Danish in 1871. Comala and Melicoma [2] are later copies (probably late 19thor early 20thcentury).

Written in brown ink on hand-ruled paper (12 staves). Glued in a blue paper cover. Text in German. Danish text partly added in black ink. Includes the passages originally to be sung by Melicoma. Danish text added later in ink and Melicoma's passages markedMelicoma. Some corrections in pencil (Gade?)
Written in brown ink on hand-ruled paper (12 staves). Glued in a blue paper cover. Text in German.

Written in ink on hand-ruled paper (10 staves), oblong format. Sewn, in blue paper cover. Text in Danish. Includes the passages originally to be sung by Melicoma. Melicoma's passages later crossed out in blue crayon.
Written in black ink on hand-ruled paper (8 staves), oblong format, unbound. Text in Danish.
Written in black ink on hand-ruled paper (8 staves), oblong format, unbound.Text in Danish.

titleStmt.title: Printed choral parts with Danish text

annot.p: 4 parts: Soprani, Alti, Tenori, Bassi. First edition with text in Danish, probably printed by Horneman & Erslev for the first performance in Danish in 1871. Printed without plate numbers directly from the engraved plates. Two reprint editions of these parts were published.

item.label: Jmf: Printed vocal parts with Danish text, The Music Society's copy

annot.p: 150 parts: S (50), A (32), T (28), B (40). Some of the parts (29 + 19 + 14 + 22) are from the original edition without plate numbers, some from the first reprint (10 + 13 + 14 + 18), and additional 11 soprano parts are WH reprints. Three of the latter parts are stampedDansk Koncert-Forening / Københavnon first page. Some of the parts glued into blue paper cover.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: COMALA, Digt efter Ossian. SOPRANI. N. W. Gade. Op. 12.

annot.p: The first reprint has the plate number 926 added, indicating that the plates were engraved for and published by Horneman & Erslev. In that case the plate number was probably added in 1874 (cf. Dan Fog:Musikhandel i Danmark, vol. II, p.182).

The second reprint is a lithographic reproduction of the original plates, made after Wilhelm Hansen had taken over Horneman & Erslev in 1879 and published by Wilhelm Hansen as number WH 926. On the first page is printed in lower margin:Kjøbenhavn, Wilhelm Hansens Forlag.On the last page, in lower margin:Wilhelm Hansens Nodestik-og Tryk, Kjöbenhavn.The publisher's name seems to indicate that the parts were printed in 1879, since in that same year the name formWilhelm Hansens Musik-Forlagwas to become the one usually employed.

p.rend: MUSIKALSK ANTHOLOGIE / UDVALGTE STYKKER / AF / Danske Operaer, Balletter, Syngespil og andre Sangcompositioner. / UDSATTE / FOR / PIANOFORTE. / Første Aargang. / KJØBENHAVN. / FORLAGT AF IMMANUEL RÉE, / Bog- og Musikhandler. / 1856.

titlePage.label: Title on first page
titlePage.p: COMALA, dramatisk Digt efter Ossian af NIELS W. GADE. / For at opmuntre Comala – Kong Fingals Brud – der ængstes, medens Helten færdes paa / Kamppladsen, synge hendes Terner følgende / BALLADE.

titlePage.label: At the bottom of the first page

p.rend: Musikalsk Anthologie IsteAarg. 1 Hefte. / Kjøbenhavn. Forl. af I. Rée.

annot.p: Published in:Musikalsk Anthologie, vol. 1/I (February 1856), pp. 5-6. Piano arrangement without words of No. 5 in Comala, arranged by Gade.

p.rend: BALLADE / af / ”COMALA” / dramatisk Digt efter Ossian / af / Niels W. Gade. / Arrangementet af Komponisten / Forlæggerens Eiendom. / KJÖBENHAVN. / Wilhelm Hansens Musik-Forlag.

annot.p: Reprint by Wilhelm Hansen as a separate item with the plate number replacing the original publisher's information at the bottom of the first page.
